stimulusHtml: After the Civil War, some businesspeople and newspaper editors—such as the Atlanta Constitution’s Henry Grady—promoted the idea of a New South. Which of the following best describes their vision for the southern states?
choicesHtml: An agricultural region consisting of small farms focused on growing food crops
An industrial region whose economic mainstays would be the mining and smelting of minerals and metals
An agricultural region of large plantations growing cotton, tobacco, and rice, worked by sharecroppers
A mixed economy no longer primarily dependent on cash crops
A postindustrial region whose economy revolved around health care, insurance, and financial services
